recipes.name: Butter Chicken
recipes.instructions:
1. Begin by gathering all ingredients required for preparing butter chicken, ensuring vegetables are washed, spices are measured, and proteins are cleaned.
2. Prepare 500g Chicken by chopping, marinating, soaking, or rinsing as traditionally required for the dish.
3. Heat oil, ghee, or butter in a kadhai or pot over medium flame until hot enough for sautéing.
4. Add aromatics such as onions, ginger, garlic, curry leaves, or whole spices and sauté until fragrant and lightly golden.
5. Add ground spices like turmeric, red chili, coriander, garam masala, or regional masalas and roast briefly to release their flavors.
6. Incorporate tomatoes, curd, coconut, tamarind, or other base ingredients depending on the dish and cook until the mixture thickens.
7. Add the prepared main ingredient along with any vegetables, dals, or meat pieces and mix thoroughly so they absorb the masala.
8. Pour in water, stock, or coconut milk (if applicable) and bring the mixture to a gentle boil.
9. Reduce heat to low and allow the dish to simmer until the main ingredient cooks fully and flavors deepen.
10. Taste and adjust seasoning, adding salt, spice, tanginess, or sweetness as needed.
11. Finish with garnishes such as coriander, ghee, cream, fried onions, or tempering (tadka) depending on regional preparation.
12. Serve hot with roti, naan, rice, dosa, or the traditional pairing for the dish.

recipes.instructions:
1. Begin by gathering all ingredients required for preparing bajra roti, ensuring vegetables are washed, spices are measured, and proteins are cleaned.
2. Prepare Millet flour by chopping, marinating, soaking, or rinsing as traditionally required for the dish.
3. Heat oil, ghee, or butter in a kadhai or pot over medium flame until hot enough for sautéing.
4. Add aromatics such as onions, ginger, garlic, curry leaves, or whole spices and sauté until fragrant and lightly golden.
5. Add ground spices like turmeric, red chili, coriander, garam masala, or regional masalas and roast briefly to release their flavors.
6. Incorporate tomatoes, curd, coconut, tamarind, or other base ingredients depending on the dish and cook until the mixture thickens.
7. Add the prepared main ingredient along with any vegetables, dals, or meat pieces and mix thoroughly so they absorb the masala.
8. Pour in water, stock, or coconut milk (if applicable) and bring the mixture to a gentle boil.
9. Reduce heat to low and allow the dish to simmer until the main ingredient cooks fully and flavors deepen.
10. Taste and adjust seasoning, adding salt, spice, tanginess, or sweetness as needed.
11. Finish with garnishes such as coriander, ghee, cream, fried onions, or tempering (tadka) depending on regional preparation.
12. Serve hot with roti, naan, rice, dosa, or the traditional pairing for the dish.

recipes.name: Kung Pao Chicken
recipes.instructions:
1. Begin by gathering and preparing all ingredients required for kung pao chicken, ensuring vegetables are chopped, proteins are cleaned, and sauces are measured.
2. Prepare 500g Chicken by cutting it into appropriate sizes; if marination is required, coat it with soy sauce, salt, or seasonings and set aside.
3. Heat a wok over high heat until it begins to smoke lightly, then add oil and swirl it around to coat the surface.
4. Add aromatics such as garlic, ginger, scallions, or chili peppers and stir-fry them for 20–30 seconds until fragrant.
5. Add the main ingredient to the wok and stir-fry vigorously, keeping the heat high to achieve proper searing and a smoky wok aroma.
6. Incorporate vegetables or secondary ingredients and continue stir-frying, adjusting heat to prevent burning.
7. Add sauces such as soy sauce, vinegar, chili paste, oyster sauce, bean paste, or any seasoning blend traditional to the dish.
8. Toss everything together to ensure even coating, and add a small amount of water or broth if a slight sauce or glaze is desired.
9. Allow the dish to cook for several more minutes, stirring occasionally, until the main ingredient is fully cooked and flavors have melded.
10. Taste and adjust salt, sweetness, or heat levels as needed, adding sugar, soy sauce, or chili oil according to preference.
11. Finish with garnishes such as scallions, sesame oil, peanuts, or herbs depending on the dish’s regional style.
12. Serve hot immediately, paired with steamed rice or noodles as traditionally enjoyed.

2. Prepare Egg noodles by cutting it into appropriate sizes; if marination is required, coat it with soy sauce, salt, or seasonings and set aside.
3. Heat a wok over high heat until it begins to smoke lightly, then add oil and swirl it around to coat the surface.
4. Add aromatics such as garlic, ginger, scallions, or chili peppers and stir-fry them for 20–30 seconds until fragrant.
5. Add the main ingredient to the wok and stir-fry vigorously, keeping the heat high to achieve proper searing and a smoky wok aroma.
6. Incorporate vegetables or secondary ingredients and continue stir-frying, adjusting heat to prevent burning.
7. Add sauces such as soy sauce, vinegar, chili paste, oyster sauce, bean paste, or any seasoning blend traditional to the dish.
8. Toss everything together to ensure even coating, and add a small amount of water or broth if a slight sauce or glaze is desired.
9. Allow the dish to cook for several more minutes, stirring occasionally, until the main ingredient is fully cooked and flavors have melded.
10. Taste and adjust salt, sweetness, or heat levels as needed, adding sugar, soy sauce, or chili oil according to preference.
11. Finish with garnishes such as scallions, sesame oil, peanuts, or herbs depending on the dish’s regional style.
12. Serve hot immediately, paired with steamed rice or noodles as traditionally enjoyed.

recipes.name: Pasta Carbonara
recipes.instructions:
1. Gather all ingredients needed to prepare pasta carbonara, ensuring produce is washed, proteins trimmed, and seasonings measured.
2. Prepare 400g Spaghetti by chopping, slicing, marinating, or cleaning it as traditionally required for the dish.
3. Heat a pan, pot, skillet, or oven to the appropriate temperature depending on whether the dish is sautéed, baked, braised, or simmered.
4. Add olive oil, butter, or another fat and allow it to heat until shimmering or melted.
5. Add aromatics such as garlic, onions, shallots, herbs, or spices and cook until fragrant and lightly golden.
6. Add the main ingredient and cook using the needed method—searing, roasting, simmering, frying, or slow-cooking—until it begins to develop color or soften.
7. Incorporate secondary ingredients like tomatoes, stock, wine, cheese, vegetables, or sauces and mix well.
8. Adjust heat to medium or low and allow ingredients to cook slowly, blending flavors and developing the dish’s texture.
9. Stir regularly and, if needed, deglaze the pan with wine, broth, or water to lift caramelized bits and enrich the flavor.
10. Taste and adjust seasoning by adding salt, pepper, herbs, acidity, or cheese according to traditional taste.
11. When the dish reaches ideal tenderness and consistency, remove from heat and let it rest briefly.
12. Plate the dish and finish with traditional garnishes such as fresh herbs, olive oil, grated cheese, or lemon zest.

3. Heat a pan, pot, skillet, or oven to the appropriate temperature depending on whether the dish is sautéed, baked, braised, or simmered.
4. Add olive oil, butter, or another fat and allow it to heat until shimmering or melted.
5. Add aromatics such as garlic, onions, shallots, herbs, or spices and cook until fragrant and lightly golden.
6. Add the main ingredient and cook using the needed method—searing, roasting, simmering, frying, or slow-cooking—until it begins to develop color or soften.
7. Incorporate secondary ingredients like tomatoes, stock, wine, cheese, vegetables, or sauces and mix well.
8. Adjust heat to medium or low and allow ingredients to cook slowly, blending flavors and developing the dish’s texture.
9. Stir regularly and, if needed, deglaze the pan with wine, broth, or water to lift caramelized bits and enrich the flavor.
10. Taste and adjust seasoning by adding salt, pepper, herbs, acidity, or cheese according to traditional taste.
11. When the dish reaches ideal tenderness and consistency, remove from heat and let it rest briefly.
12. Plate the dish and finish with traditional garnishes such as fresh herbs, olive oil, grated cheese, or lemon zest.

recipes.instructions:
1. Gather all ingredients needed to prepare panettone, ensuring produce is washed, proteins trimmed, and seasonings measured.
2. Prepare Flour by chopping, slicing, marinating, or cleaning it as traditionally required for the dish.
3. Heat a pan, pot, skillet, or oven to the appropriate temperature depending on whether the dish is sautéed, baked, braised, or simmered.
4. Add olive oil, butter, or another fat and allow it to heat until shimmering or melted.
5. Add aromatics such as garlic, onions, shallots, herbs, or spices and cook until fragrant and lightly golden.
6. Add the main ingredient and cook using the needed method—searing, roasting, simmering, frying, or slow-cooking—until it begins to develop color or soften.
7. Incorporate secondary ingredients like tomatoes, stock, wine, cheese, vegetables, or sauces and mix well.
8. Adjust heat to medium or low and allow ingredients to cook slowly, blending flavors and developing the dish’s texture.
9. Stir regularly and, if needed, deglaze the pan with wine, broth, or water to lift caramelized bits and enrich the flavor.
10. Taste and adjust seasoning by adding salt, pepper, herbs, acidity, or cheese according to traditional taste.
11. When the dish reaches ideal tenderness and consistency, remove from heat and let it rest briefly.
12. Plate the dish and finish with traditional garnishes such as fresh herbs, olive oil, grated cheese, or lemon zest.

recipes.name: Pad Thai
recipes.instructions:
1. Gather all ingredients required for pad thai, ensuring herbs, vegetables, proteins, and pastes are cleaned, measured, and prepared.
2. Prepare 200g Rice noodles by slicing, cleaning, marinating, or chopping it according to the traditional requirements of the dish.
3. Heat a wok or pot over medium to high heat, adding oil or coconut cream depending on the dish’s authentic preparation style.
4. Add aromatics such as garlic, chilies, shallots, lemongrass, kaffir lime leaves, or galangal and sauté until fragrant.
5. Add curry paste, seasoning pastes, or dry spices if the recipe uses them and fry briefly to release their essential oils.
6. Add the main ingredient and stir-fry or simmer until it begins to develop color or absorb the flavors of the aromatics.
7. Incorporate vegetables, herbs, or secondary proteins as required and toss or mix evenly.
8. Add liquids such as coconut milk, broth, tamarind water, or seasoning sauces and bring to a gentle boil.
9. Reduce heat and simmer until all ingredients are thoroughly cooked, flavors meld, and the sauce reaches desired consistency.
10. Taste and adjust seasoning using fish sauce, lime juice, palm sugar, tamarind, or chili to balance sweet–sour–salty–spicy elements.
11. Add finishing touches such as Thai basil, coriander, fried garlic, roasted rice powder, or chili oil depending on the dish.
12. Serve hot with jasmine rice, sticky rice, fresh vegetables, or noodles as traditionally paired with the dish.

recipes.name: Gaeng Tai Pla (Southern Fish Curry)
recipes.instructions:

3. Heat a wok or pot over medium to high heat, adding oil or coconut cream depending on the dish’s authentic preparation style.
4. Add aromatics such as garlic, chilies, shallots, lemongrass, kaffir lime leaves, or galangal and sauté until fragrant.

6. Add the main ingredient and stir-fry or simmer until it begins to develop color or absorb the flavors of the aromatics.

9. Reduce heat and simmer until all ingredients are thoroughly cooked, flavors meld, and the sauce reaches desired consistency.

2. Prepare Rice flour by slicing, cleaning, marinating, or chopping it according to the traditional requirements of the dish.
3. Heat a wok or pot over medium to high heat, adding oil or coconut cream depending on the dish’s authentic preparation style.
4. Add aromatics such as garlic, chilies, shallots, lemongrass, kaffir lime leaves, or galangal and sauté until fragrant.
5. Add curry paste, seasoning pastes, or dry spices if the recipe uses them and fry briefly to release their essential oils.
6. Add the main ingredient and stir-fry or simmer until it begins to develop color or absorb the flavors of the aromatics.
7. Incorporate vegetables, herbs, or secondary proteins as required and toss or mix evenly.
8. Add liquids such as coconut milk, broth, tamarind water, or seasoning sauces and bring to a gentle boil.
9. Reduce heat and simmer until all ingredients are thoroughly cooked, flavors meld, and the sauce reaches desired consistency.
10. Taste and adjust seasoning using fish sauce, lime juice, palm sugar, tamarind, or chili to balance sweet–sour–salty–spicy elements.
11. Add finishing touches such as Thai basil, coriander, fried garlic, roasted rice powder, or chili oil depending on the dish.
12. Serve hot with jasmine rice, sticky rice, fresh vegetables, or noodles as traditionally paired with the dish.

recipes.name: Coq au Vin
recipes.instructions:
1. Prepare all ingredients required for coq au vin, ensuring everything is cleaned, chopped, and measured.
2. Season or marinate Coq according to the traditional flavors of the dish.
3. Heat oil, butter, or fat in a pot, skillet, or pan over medium heat until shimmering.
4. Add aromatics such as onions, garlic, herbs, or spices and sauté until fragrant and lightly browned.
5. Add the main ingredient and sear, sauté, or brown it to develop flavor.
6. Incorporate vegetables, broths, wine, tomatoes, or sauces depending on the style of the recipe.
7. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce heat to low and allow it to simmer for flavor development.
8. Stir occasionally, scraping the bottom to prevent sticking or burning.
9. Adjust seasoning using salt, herbs, pepper, spices, wine, or lemon juice to balance flavors.
10. Continue cooking until the main ingredient reaches ideal tenderness and the sauce thickens properly.
11. Add finishing elements such as fresh herbs, butter, olive oil, or garnishes.
12. Serve hot with side dishes traditionally paired with this recipe.

3. Heat oil, butter, or fat in a pot, skillet, or pan over medium heat until shimmering.
4. Add aromatics such as onions, garlic, herbs, or spices and sauté until fragrant and lightly browned.
5. Add the main ingredient and sear, sauté, or brown it to develop flavor.
6. Incorporate vegetables, broths, wine, tomatoes, or sauces depending on the style of the recipe.
7. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce heat to low and allow it to simmer for flavor development.
8. Stir occasionally, scraping the bottom to prevent sticking or burning.
9. Adjust seasoning using salt, herbs, pepper, spices, wine, or lemon juice to balance flavors.
10. Continue cooking until the main ingredient reaches ideal tenderness and the sauce thickens properly.
11. Add finishing elements such as fresh herbs, butter, olive oil, or garnishes.
12. Serve hot with side dishes traditionally paired with this recipe.

recipes.name: Dal Rice
recipes.instructions:
1. Gather and prepare all ingredients required for dal rice, washing, peeling, and cutting where needed.
2. Prepare 1 cup Rice by cleaning, cutting, or marinating according to the traditional approach for this dish.
3. Heat oil or butter in a pan over medium heat until hot enough for sautéing.
4. Add aromatics such as onions, garlic, ginger, herbs, or spices and sauté until fragrant and lightly golden.
5. Add the main ingredient and cook while stirring regularly to ensure even browning.
6. Incorporate tomatoes, broth, sauces, or spice blends if the dish calls for them, letting everything mix well.
7. Add water or stock as necessary and reduce the heat to low, allowing the dish to simmer gently.
8. Continue simmering until the main ingredient is cooked through and the flavors have blended deeply.
9. Adjust the seasoning with salt, pepper, herbs, or lemon juice according to taste preferences.
10. Finish by adding any garnishes or final touches traditionally used in this dish and serve hot.

recipes.name: Pork Cutlet Classic
recipes.instructions:
1. Gather all ingredients required for pork cutlet classic, washing and preparing as needed.
2. Prepare main proteins or vegetables by cutting, marinating, or cleaning as appropriate.
3. Heat appropriate cooking vessel (wok, pan, grill, oven) to required temperature.
4. Add oil or fat and heat until shimmering.
5. Add aromatics and stir until fragrant.
6. Add main ingredient and sear or cook until color develops.
7. Incorporate secondary ingredients and sauces/pastes.
8. Add liquids like broth, coconut milk, or water if needed.
9. Reduce heat and simmer until flavors meld and main ingredient is cooked through.
10. Adjust seasoning with salt, sugar, fish sauce, or soy as per the cuisine.
11. Finish with fresh herbs, citrus, or garnishes typical to the cuisine.
12. Serve hot with traditional accompaniments.
